newsitem.title: USA: San Juan 350 MW unit seen restarted Fri after leak.
newsitem.headline: San Juan 350 MW unit seen restarted Fri after leak.

text.p: The 350 megawatt (MW) unit 2 at the San Juan coal-fired power plant in New Mexico is scheduled to restart Friday after being shut Wednesday due to a boiler tube leak, sources familiar with the plant's operations said Thursday.
The latest outage followed efforts to restart the unit after a maintenance shutdown which began in early April.
The San Juan plant also has a second 350 MW unit and two 540 MW units.
The power plant is operated by Public Service Co of New Mexico.
